items.prompt: Which phrase is used to thank someone for their time?

items.prompt: Match the phrases with their meanings:
What follows 'Thank you for...' when using a verb?

items.prompt: They called ________ (a nosotros) for a meeting.

items.prompt: Which phrase is common in a follow-up about a job?

items.prompt: I don't have the file. Can you send ________ (ello) to me?

items.prompt: What is 'Appreciation'?

items.explanation: We use the object pronoun 'him' after the preposition 'to'.

items.explanation: 'Us' is the object pronoun for 'we'.

items.prompt: What does 'Grateful' mean?

items.prompt: Identify the error: 'Can you help I with this task?'
items.explanation: It should be 'me' instead of the subject pronoun 'I'.

items.prompt: Thank you ________ (por) everything.
items.explanation: We use 'for' after 'Thank you' to specify the reason.

items.prompt: Translate: 'A ella le gusta ello'.
items.explanation: Subject 'She' + verb 'likes' + object 'it'.

items.prompt: The manager wants to see ________ (a ti) in his office.
items.explanation: 'You' is both the subject and object pronoun for the second person.

items.prompt: What is 'Follow-up' as a noun?
items.explanation: As a noun, 'Follow-up' means the act of following up.

items.text:
Dear Mr. Garcia,

Thank you for meeting with me yesterday. I really appreciate the time you spent explaining the new project. I am very interested in the opportunity to work with your team.

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Laura Martinez

questions.prompt: When did the meeting take place?
questions.explanation: Laura says: 'Thank you for meeting with me yesterday'.

questions.prompt: What did Mr. Garcia explain?
questions.explanation: The text mentions 'explaining the new project'.

I am writing to follow up on the sales numbers we discussed on Tuesday. Could you please send them to me when you have a chance? I need them for the weekly meeting tomorrow morning.
